Html:
I am working with MVCMusicStore App but i am getting error while running the application.

i.e. Unable to find the requested .Net Framework Data Provider.  It may not be installed.  

the above error is coming when i make a request to http://localhost:1040/Store

could anybody resolve this problem?

I have the same issue.

Any help would be appreciated.

[ Visual Studio 2010 - SP1Rel // .NET Framework 4.0.30319 ]

This is usually due to not having the prerequisites installed. See the "Installing the software" section here: http://www.asp.net/mvc/tutorials/mvc-music-store/mvc-music-store-part-1

There are some earlier discussions with the same question, e.g. http://mvcmusicstore.codeplex.com/discussions/277370

Let me know if you still see this error after verifying that you've got the required software installed.

- Jon
I've installed all the pre-requisites and I still get the same error.

Can you run the completed application code (included in the main download at http://mvcmusicstore.codeplex.com/) and see if you get the same error? That will let us know if the problem is in your application's code or if it's a problem with installed software.

From: dego [notifications@codeplex.com]
Sent: Sunday, May 06, 2012 9:56 PM
To: Jon Galloway
Subject: Re: Unable to find the requested .Net Framework Data Provider. It may not be installed. [mvcmusicstore:354646]

From: dego

I've installed all the pre-requisites and I still get the same error.
I did run the completed code and the same error occurs

Can you try running the Web Platform Installer for VS2010 SP1? It should check to make sure you've got the necessesary prereqs: http://www.microsoft.com/web/gallery/install.aspx?appid=VWDorVS2010SP1Pack

From: dego [notifications@codeplex.com]
Sent: Sunday, May 06, 2012 10:21 PM
To: Jon Galloway
Subject: Re: Unable to find the requested .Net Framework Data Provider. It may not be installed. [mvcmusicstore:354646]

From: dego

I did run the completed code and the same error occurs
Ive installed  Web Platform Installer for VS2010 SP1 twice. Any suggestions are appreciated.

I was able to solve the same problem:

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/6508516/asp-net-mvc-3-unable-to-find-the-requested-net-framework-data-provider

However, I have a similar MVC 2 project and it is working just fine without applying this. Not sure if this is related with MVC 3 only.
Thank you so much jemunsayac. That worked!
